title: Digital Accessibility-Based Gamification Language Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage proficiency and foundational understanding of language learning
context.additional_context: A language education course using gamification elements accessible to all learners via smartphones. Requires design considerations for accessibility across disability types

learning_goals: Learners can apply basic grammar of the target language (Korean) with 80% accuracy using gamification elements (quests, reward systems).
Learners understand digital accessibility principles (e.g., screen reading, high-contrast settings) and can apply at least three of them to gamified content.
Learners improve interaction skills with peer learners by over 70% through collaborative mission performance in gamification-based language learning activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
